intro: Mentzelia lobata, commonly known as the narrowleaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a lobed or toothed appearance, contributing to its common name. Mentzelia lobata is known for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
